body:
@bschoening , @driftx - There is no test for this reported issue but  field_size_limit  was
 introduced in - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-8934 as a bug fix. It seems it was always "unused"? What do I miss? Can you take a look, please? After that one is confirmed, please feel free to commit this one. I will be off until Tuesday, no need to wait for me.
[100 repeats](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/1058/workflows/fa0924bb-c2d2-4427-962f-cb690ef7bcc2/jobs/27829) CI as requested

As noted in the comments on the Jira, the implementation of field_size_limit is left over from Cassandra v2.0 before the copy from/copy to behavior was refactored into the copyutil.py file (2.1.13) in [CASSANDRA-9304](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-9304).  Copy options, not command line arguments, are now used to provide similar support for options. The field_size_limit arg to CQLSH its  been a non-functional since that time.

The only thing that itches me is the complete removal of the 'fail' path. That is the removal of the legit timeouts whose reasons I understand thanks to the explanations on the ticket. I have no better proposal the the check `maxNodesDown()` already does. So LGTM +1

Thanks for all the feedback. After thinking about that code over the weekend, I realized that I misunderstood some part of the existing code and worst than that it seems that I am not the only one. @Maxwell-Guo question about Vectors, triggered some investigation on my side. The code work but the path being used is not the one that people would expect. It was also the case for Tuples before that patch. My feeling is that the code is more confusing than I realized and needs to be refactored further.
I am going back to the drawing board.
Should the auth creation wait time be lowered as well to improve test times?

@smiklosovic I moved the check part out of the `deriveSession` function so we always have a session when throwing error. I removed the unit test since we have the jvm dtest to test this feature and it is not easy to test if it is moved out of the `deriveSession` function.

- Can't you create `waitForExistingRoles` in `CQLTester` i.e. and then it can be called from everywhere? That would remove the new single method class for jvm and it could be reused from junits as well iiuc
- You don't seem to have reduced the delay to 0 for unit tests?
- Missing CI and repeats

Indeed I forgot about setting the delay to 0 for unit tests. Fixed now.

I'll not move that method outside of the distributed "module" because it applies only to the in-jvm distributed tests, where the delay is non-zero. I'd like to not modify the delay for the distributed tests as they usually start multiple nodes and we may fall into another category of problems.

Repeated tests on CircleCI makes zero sense to me in this case because:
1. the problem has not popped up on CircleCI, so why would it now?
2. I found the problem and was able to reproduce it reliably - then after applying a fix, the problem went away

- Does `ServerTestUtils.java` have unsued imports now?
- The change in `CQLTester` impacts 90% of junits so a CI run is mandatory here imo.
- The repeated runs are not optional AFAIK so we'll need them. Do a 100 or 500 if you're confident enough...
@bereng I'll obviously run the CI
Do we want to do anything w/ `cassandra.yaml` in this patch? Perhaps a couple simple examples w/ inline comments there?
@qannap can you create branches against `5.0` and `trunk` and at least verify the implemented test if it passes?

- [ ] trunk [j11](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/868/workflows/1a65d5e7-c3ea-415f-bf6a-eb7048775d22)
- [x] 5.0 [j11](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/870/workflows/b9a4d2b6-1d42-4f02-a071-73f463e0094f)

@JeremiahDJordan @bereng It seems like I cannot move that method to `Cluster` as we get class loader problems.

There is no need to deprecate the library usage in 5.0 release. We've agreed to remote it in 5.0 as well:

https://lists.apache.org/thread/pdq1y2xks629lh6h7nfc6mt5gp145bs6

Ok the current PRs seem to all have the code moved into `Cluster`. You need to push new ones yes?

Just for reference the old CI runs you have previous to the move [here](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/2672#issuecomment-1711554643) are fine. You're hitiing c16778 and c18360 on trunk
Reverted to the `Auth` approach.
@bereng can we merge that?
Right I see you reverted all PRs. +1 though I still dislike the single utility class... :shrug:

Me too @bereng, believe me.

Thanks for review!
@maedhroz, @dcapwell - so is it now ok? can I squash the commits?

https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/879/workflows/302cc4ea-56b2-46ad-8d47-f66e812d1a63

test failures were reported in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-18737

@jacek-lewandowski Things are looking pretty good. The only thing I forgot about WRT preempts in `AccordClientRequestMetrics` is that it's segregated for write/read-only transactions. If that's useful, we might want to add it back. (Hopefully not a big deal...just a few lines.)

Otherwise, +1 to squash...
Sorry, been away from this patch for a very long time.  If 2 committers are +1 to this patch please don't wait for me and feel free to merge.  I don't know when I will have time to review again.

@krummas was reviewing accord code that touched TCM and found `org.apache.cassandra.tcm.Retry.Backoff#Backoff()`. This implies to me that there is logical overlap with this patch and a difference with how configs are managed.  Would be good to address this duplication in this patch so we align well when TCM merges

@maedhroz all the metrics in `AccordMetrics` are already separated to read-only and read-write.

Thanks for the thorough review guys!
@dcapwell do you have more comments ?

Green [CI](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/1066/workflows/e712e5bc-0b2f-4963-ad41-cb734e4bfc2b/jobs/28644)

I updated the patch it now:
* removes the `MultiItemTerminal` and `MultiColumnRaw` interfaces
* represents IN bind marker as `Terms` instead of having 2 different representations (a list of terms and a single MultiItemTerminal).
* replaces the `AbstractMarker` hierachy by the `Marker` class
* introduces a new `MultiElementType` that becomes a super class of all the `CollectionTypes`, `TupleType`, `UserType` and `VectorType` (standardizing the `pack` and `unpack` method name and their modifiers)
* replaces the `Value` and `DelayedValue` implementations for the `Lists`, `Sets`, `Maps`, `Tuples`, `UserTypes` and `Vectors` classes by the `MultiElements` `Value` and `DelayedValue` classes.

Merged in 4.1/5.0-trunk - closing.

Thanks @jonmeredith !

There are no failures that can be related to the patch, and the new test passes the repeated runs on all branches.

Merging.

Thanks for the review. I have added an explicit exception about the empty/null value in those places where we used to manage the empty values. The error message is simply `Invalid empty vector value`, I don't know if there is a better idea for it.
